description: Numbers with no 3 adjacent 0's in binary expansion.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
David Garth and Adam Gouge, Affinely Self-Generating Sets and Morphisms, Journal of Integer Sequences, Article 07.1.5, 10 (2007) 1-13.
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
mathematica: Select[Range[0,100],SequenceCount[IntegerDigits[#,2],{0,0,0}]==0&] (* The program uses the SequenceCount function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 12 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a003796 n = a003796_list !! (n-1)a003796_list = filter f [0..] where   f x  = x < 4 || x `mod` 8 /= 0 && f (x `div` 2)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 01 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
